name: Sentosa
description: Sentosa is an island resort off Singapore’s southern coast, connected to the city by road, cable car, pedestrian boardwalk and monorail. By Sentosa Station, Tiger Sky Tower has panoramic views

name: Gardens by the Bay
tagline: Modern public gardens on reclaimed land
description: A network of modern greenhouses & waterfront parks containing super trees lined with solar cells.

name: Marina Bay Sands, Singapore
tagline: Posh hotel with an infinity pool & a spa
description: Airy quarters in a vibrant property with an infinity pool & a spa, plus high-end restaurants & bars.

name: Universal Studios Singapore
description: Movie amusement park with sets & rides on themes from Hollywood to sci-fi, plus live entertainment.

name: Orchard Road
description: This well-known, 2.2-km route features shopping malls & boutiques, plus restaurants & luxe hotels.

name: Night Safari, Singapore
tagline: Zoo for nocturnal animals opened in 1994
description: Night zoo with tram rides and walking trails through rainforest past elephants, tigers & leopards.

name: Merlion Park
description: Iconic, 8.5m-tall statue with the body of a fish & head of a lion, shooting water from its mouth.

name: Singapore Zoo
description: Rainforest zoo with tram rides, trails & viewing platforms to see wildlife habitats & exhibits.

name: Singapore Flyer
description: Huge observation wheel opened in 2008 for views of the city plus high tea & butler-serviced flights.

name: Clarke Quay
description: Mall with restaurants & nightlife in redeveloped, 19th-century, riverside commercial district.

name: Resorts World Sentosa
tagline: Upscale resort with chic hotels & a spa
description: Lively property with 6 themed hotels & a spa, plus outdoor pools, an aquarium & eclectic dining.

name: Singapore Botanic Gardens
description: 183-acre botanical gardens with sculptures, a swan lake & significant collection of tropical trees.

name: River Safari
description: Zoo & aquarium with a river theme offering boat rides, freshwater fish & animals, including pandas.

name: Jurong Bird Park
description: Sprawling sanctuary housing over 400 bird species from parrots to penguins, plus play areas & cafes.

name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore
description: Futuristic waterfront arts venue with 1,600-seat concert hall, 2,000-person theatre, studios & mall.

name: National Gallery Singapore
tagline: Asian art museum in a historic building
description: Museum of Singapore & Southeast Asian arts housed in a restored municipal building dating to 1929.

name: Pulau Ubin
tagline: Chek Jawa Wetlands & Da Bo Gong Temple
description: Pulau Ubin is an island northeast of mainland Singapore. Cycle trails and footpaths criss-cross the hills, going past disused granite quarries and traditional kampongs (villages). Kingfishers

name: ArtScience Museum
description: Design, science & technology exhibits in a distinctive, modern, flower-shaped building.

name: East Coast Park
tagline: Strip of public beach with activities
description: White, sandy beach with a skate park, water sports and sports facilities, plus local food sellers.

name: Mount Faber
tagline: Hilltop spot with scenic city views
description: Trails & a cable car lead up to this popular hilltop park offering scenic views of the city skyline.

name: Singapore Cable Car
description: The Singapore Cable Car is a gondola lift providing an aerial link from Mount Faber on the main island of Singapore to the resort island of Sentosa across the Keppel Harbour. Opened on 15 February

name: VivoCity
tagline: Sprawling shopping mall in modern digs
description: Expansive, modern shopping center hosting a wide range of retailers, restaurants & theaters.

name: Sentosa Luge
tagline: Skyline Luge Sentosa is a luge located in Sentosa, Singapore. The attraction opened in the second half of 2005. The luge, situated on the Imbiah Lookout cluster opposite the Tiger Sky Tower,

name: MacRitchie Reservoir
tagline: Scenic lake with trails & a park
description: Scenic artificial lake with boating, perimeter trails & a public park with a bandstand.

name: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum
tagline: Temple with Buddha relics & a garden
description: Tang dynasty–style temple housing religious relics, with ornate rooms & a tranquil rooftop garden.

name: Fort Canning Hill
description: A well-known historical landmark, this grassy hilltop park hosts events such as concerts & plays.

name: National Museum of Singapore
description: Classical & modern architecture converge in this large, vibrant museum of Singaporean artifacts.

name: Sri Mariamman Temple, Singapore
description: Built in 1827, the city's oldest Hindu temple features a tower densely ornamented with deities.

name: Fort Siloso
tagline: World War II museum in a coastal fort
description: Restored World War II coastal fort housing a military museum with interactive exhibits & tours.

name: Helix Bridge
description: Steel footbridge, opened in 2010, inspired by the curved form of the structure of DNA.

name: Masjid Sultan
description: Landmark Islamic house of worship in the Kampong Glam Malay Heritage District, with guided tours.

name: Suntec City
description: Large, modern mall featuring a vast array of well-known retailers, along with dining options.

name: National Orchid Garden
tagline: Thousands of rare orchids on display
description: Serene hilltop showcase of thousands of orchid species, plus bromeliads & carnivorous plants.

name: Southern Ridges
tagline: Paved walking path with city views
description: Scenic, paved walking path connecting to many parks with bridges, wildlife & city views.

name: Lau Pa Sat
description: Rebuilt Victorian covered hawker centre in CBD with local delicacies & international food stalls.

name: Tiger Sky Tower
description: An enclosed cabin rotates to the top of this high observation tower with sweeping views.

name: Haw Par Villa
description: Unique park using giant statues & dioramas to retell historic Chinese legends & religious mythology.

name: Raffles Place
description: Raffles Place is the centre of the Financial District of Singapore and is located south of the mouth of the Singapore River. It was first planned and developed in the 1820s as Commercial Square

name: Bukit Timah
description: Bukit Timah, often abbreviated as Bt Timah, is a planning area and residential estate located in the westernmost part of the Central Region of Singapore. Bukit Timah lies roughly 10 kilometres

name: Marine Life Park
tagline: SEA Aquarium & Adventure Cove Water Park
description: Large aquarium with rare species & seafood restaurant, plus a water park with slides & a lazy river.

name: Marina Barrage
description: Reservoir & kayaking destination featuring a gallery with interactive exhibits on sustainability.

name: Siloso Beach
tagline: Sandy stretch with sports, shops & bars
description: Wide sandy beach hosting volleyball & water sports, with bars, shopping & dining lining the strand.

name: Bukit Timah Nature Reserve
description: Leafy, tropical nature reserve surrounding a hilltop with walking trails & a visitor center.

name: Images of Singapore
tagline: Local history museum with actor guides
description: Museum tracing the history of Singapore with a 45-minute, actor-guided tour & a themed boat ride.

name: Wings Of Time
tagline: Venue for a colorful nighttime show
description: Modern venue featuring a nightly show with colorful lights, lasers, water fountains & 3D effects.

name: Fountain of Wealth
tagline: Giant landmark fountain in a mall
description: Huge contemporary outdoor fountain in a shopping complex, offering nightly light shows.

name: CHIJMES
description: A former convent & school, this 19th-century structure now houses restaurants, bars & event space.

name: Asian Civilisations Museum
description: Museum exploring the history & cultures of Asia & their shaping of contemporary Singapore.

name: Peranakan Museum
description: Peranakan culture is explored through interactive & multimedia exhibits in a historic 1912 building.

name: Battlestar Galactica
description: Battlestar Galactica: Human vs. Cylon is a pair of steel, dueling roller coasters at Universal Studios Singapore. One of the coasters is an inverted roller coaster track in grey, and the other
